KSP 2 v0.1.0.0

OS: Windows 10  (10.0.19045) 64bit
CPU: AMD Ryzen 7 1700 Eight-Core Processor  (16)
RAM: 16316
GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080 (8072MB)

Observed Behavior: Occasionally time warping will cause my ship to accelerate. This is even when engines are deactivated and RCS is off. This acceleration continues until I get a warning that time warp stops because of lack of fuel, but time warp can be immediately restarted. No fuel is consumed. This continues until the game restarts. There does not appear to be a limit on speed increase. 

Expected Behavior: Time warp without thrust does not cause acceleration.

Steps to Replicate: Unclear what causes it to begin. Once it begins, I do not know how to stop it. It usually happens when there are multiple spacecraft near each other, i.e. after undocking or around rendezvous, but unclear if this is only when I notice it. 

Fixes / Workarounds: Restarting the game appears to stop it.

Mods: None

Video: https://imgur.com/bkYhXPY
